cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 455 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north through the eastern Gulf of Mexico, expected to strike the Florida Panhandle Wednesday and then arc northeast across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic before moving offshore and racing toward Atlantic Canada
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle / Big Bend coast near Panama City–Apalachicola

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Alabama/Florida border to Mississippi/Alabama border; Storm Surge Watch: Anclote River FL to Anna Maria Island FL & AL/FL border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL; Tropical Storm Watch: Chassahowitzka FL to Anna Maria Island FL and MS/AL border to Pearl River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL and Pinar del Rio Cuba; Storm Surge Warning: Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL to Anclote River FL; Tropical Storm Warning: AL/FL border to MS/AL border, Suwannee River to Chassahowitzka FL and Isle of Youth Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Florida, then the Southeast and entire U.S. East Coast including the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (13%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts 40–45 mph possible Thursday night–Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding under 3 ft possible along Delaware Bay as the storm exits
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Thursday night–Friday with totals 2–4 in. and isolated 6 in., creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and possible brief navigation restrictions due to reduced visibility and gusty squalls
